body_html: I agree it seems cleaner to provide sequence_lengths to the decoder_fn instead of having dynamic_decoder do it. However, it also makes the dynamic_decoder that much more complicated (and it's already quite complicated). What do you think? I'm open on this one; happy to either have the dynamic_decoder take care of it when inputs is not None, but also happy to let the decoder_fn take care of it.
body_text: I agree it seems cleaner to provide sequence_lengths to the decoder_fn instead of having dynamic_decoder do it.  However, it also makes the dynamic_decoder that much more complicated (and it's already quite complicated).  What do you think?  I'm open on this one; happy to either have the dynamic_decoder take care of it when inputs is not None, but also happy to let the decoder_fn take care of it.
body: I agree it seems cleaner to provide sequence_lengths to the decoder_fn instead of having dynamic_decoder do it.  However, it also makes the dynamic_decoder that much more complicated (and it's already quite complicated).  What do you think?  I'm open on this one; happy to either have the dynamic_decoder take care of it when `inputs` is not `None`, but also happy to let the `decoder_fn` take care of it.
